SEARCH
Package org.boardgames.crossway.model.rules

Interface PatternRule

All Known Implementing Classes:
BoundsRule, DiagonalXRule, EmptyRule
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface PatternRule
An interface for a rule that validates a proposed move in the Crossway game.

Each implementation of this interface represents a single, self-contained rule of the game. The primary method, validate, checks if a move conforms to a specific pattern or condition. This design allows for a modular and extensible rule-checking system, where rules can be added, removed, or combined without affecting the core game logic.

The rules are validated on a "what-if" basis; the validate method assumes the move has already been made and checks for any resulting illegal patterns. If a violation is found, it returns an Optional containing a PatternViolation object with details about the rule broken and the location of the infringement. If the move is valid with respect to the rule, an empty Optional is returned.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Optional<PatternViolation>
    validate(Board board, Move move)
    Validates a hypothetical move against a specific game rule.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      Optional<PatternViolation> validate(Board board, Move move)
      Validates a hypothetical move against a specific game rule.

      This method checks for a violation by analyzing the board state as if the specified move has just been completed. It should not modify the board state itself.

      Parameters:
      board - The current game board.
      move - The proposed move to validate.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing a PatternViolation if the move breaks the rule, or an empty Optional if the move is valid.
